CustomEvent.summary: The CustomEvent interface can be used to attach custom data to an event generated by an application.

remarks.para: As an alternative to CustomEvent, you can subclass the Event interface to add custom data and behavior.

blockquote.para: If used to attempt to communicate between a web extension content script and a web page script, a non-string detail property throws with "Permission denied to access property" in Firefox. To avoid this issue clone the object. See Share objects with page scripts for more information.

CustomEventCustomEvent.summary: The CustomEvent() constructor creates a new object.

CustomEventDetail.summary: The read-only detail property of the interface returns any data passed when initializing the event.
CustomEventDetail.value: Whatever data the event was initialized with.
